ovdesc.p: Security Management System uses the EB.USER.PROFILEapplication, to control T24 access and information and facilities by grouping together various T24 Applications.
Enables the creation of logical group and specifies the group directly in a user profile, to avoid repetition of related applications, in different user profiles.
Every user record existing in T24 must have a role defined for them.
Specific Role needs to be defined for each company.
A user is allowed to have multiple roles in a same company. But while logging in, the user has to select a role, if merging is disabled.

desc.p: Specifies the functions, which are used to access the records of the Application, entered in the corresponding Field 2.
This field is used, together with the associated Fields 2-3 and 5-8 to specify precisely, which function, the user uses to access which record and in which Application.
Valid function codes are: A 2 C D E H I L P Q R S V
If NOT is entered, plus one or more Function codes, the system converts the code into a list of all the Functions which are allowed. (See Fields 2, 3 and 5 for examples.)
Note:During an input function, even if the function C (copy) is not allowed, the user can transfer the ID (together with its enrichment) of a selected record using the ! facility.

Note: It is not possible to prevent a user from entering on override during input, but Authorization can be restricted, as above, to ensure that any overrides are checked by a more senior person is the lowest value a field can have, so specifying LT (Less Than) ensures that no override may be present.
Restricting FOREX transaction to counterparties, that belong to a specific account officer.
Note: The field specified does not have to belong to the application. If the system can link the APPLICATION to the field, then the SMS restriction will be applied.

In this example the COUNTERPARTY field on the FOREX file provides the link to the CUSTOMER file. Hence when the transaction is input, T24 reads the CUSTOMER file using the COUNTERPARTY as the key and checks that the ACCOUNT.OFFICER is 100. You do not have to define COUNTERPARTY as the key to CUSTOMER file. It is done automatically based on the RELATED.FILE stored in the STANDARD.SELECTION record for FOREX.

Note: If the user wants to test a value in a related file, a consderable process load can be incurred, when the user lists the file. This can be relieved by defining the related field as a J-descriptor user field on the STANDARD.SELECTION record.
Thus in the example above, define CUST.OFFICER as type J, CUSTOMER,ACCOUNT.OFFICER and then specify the FIELD.NO as FOREXCUST.OFFICER.

desc.p: Specifies a Version, which is used to access the records, that are entered in the corresponding APPLICATION (Field 2.1).
This field is used, together with the associated Fields 2-8, to specify precisely, is accessed by the user and in which Application , using which Versions and Functions.

p.p: * and ? - specifies more than one Version. They act as wild card characters.
* - replaces any number of characters including null, numbers, alphabets etc.
? - replaces one character including null, numbers, alphabets etc.

desc.p: Specifies the name of an existing Application to be included in EB.USER.ROLES record.

p.p: E.g. the name of an existing application USER.SMS.GROUP preceded by '@' sign,
ALL.PG which allows access to all Applications or
ALL.PG.(program type) which allows access to all Applications for a certain type (see below).

desc.p: The following program types can be used in conjunction with ALL.PG (e.g. ALL.PG.H) to give access to a particular type of program:

p.p: H Program - 3 standard files exist - Live, Unauthorised and History, e.g. CUSTOMER.
U Program - Live and Unauthorised files exist, but no History, e.g. VERSION.
L Program - only a Live file exists (updated automatically by the system) e.g. STMT.ENTRY (only L, S and P functions can be used with this type of program).
M Program - designed to do other than processing the standard T24 functions using a specific file e.g. PASSWORD.ENABLE, End Of Day Batch programs.
T Program - handles automatically updated CONCAT files, e.g. CUSTOMER.ACCOUNT (only L, S and P functions can be used with this type of program).

When defining the enquires a user can run, and also turn off all SMS checks for a particular enquiry. This is useful when the enquiry presents non sensitive information from sensitive files.
i.e. you may wish to show customer and account static information (address, account titles etc ) but not the balances.
As the enquiry by itself controls the presentation, there may be no need for any additional security. To suppress SMS you must append *NOSMS to the name of the enquiry.
